conclusion: Principles of shadow formation influence shadow size and position.
Objects are a birdcage, a chicken leg, a small bird, and a spoon casting shadows on the ground.
Light source is initially positioned above the objects casting shadows on the ground.
When the light source moves to the right, the shadow cast by the objects will shift accordingly.
The shadow of the objects will move to the right as the light source moves to the right.
The shadow size will increase as the light source moves to the right.
The shadow of the objects will shift to the right, maintaining the same angle relative to the light source.
The shadow of the objects will move to the right, with the shadow size increasing and the shadow position remaining consistent.
The shadow of the objects will move to the right, with the shadow size increasing and the shadow position remaining consistent.
